reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying at The Ritz-Carlton Toronto in late March for a friend’s birthday and I have to say that they have definitely brought a new level of luxury to Toronto. They surpass any competition in every aspect, from when you pull up to the valet upon arrival to check-out the next morning.
reviews.title: Attention to both guests and details!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a friendly valet and doorman (my friend got a good deal when booking the room and valet for one vehicle was included, normal price around $45 I believe). The lobby of the hotel was brilliant, marble, wood and comfortable loungers placed conveniently; the TOCA bar was on the immediate left with TOCA the restaurant above it. The DEQ Lounge was at the back of the lobby. Upon checking in, the front desk greeted my friend by name, and actually accompanied us to the room to show us the unique amenities found there. As the hotel knew he was celebrating a birthday they left a surprise chocolate log/cake in the room, which we devoured immediately. We booked a corner suite, to get into it one must use the key to get through an entrance door into a little corridor where only the doors to two separate suites are found (a nice touch for privacy). The bedroom was huge, with a large comfy king size bed and a wall of windows with a beautiful half-view of the lake and city. A large LCD TV was placed on top of a dresser with a great set of Bose speakers on the bedside table, perfect for hooking up an Ipod or laptop and pumping some music. The closet was the largest I’ve seen in a hotel and contained a large safe and tons of space to hang your clothing. The washroom was located off the main hallway connecting the bedroom and living area (the hallway was filled with windows showing the spectacular view). The bathroom was huge, with heated flooring and a large double countertop, the mirror contained one of those small built-in TV’s. The toilet was in a separate locked room (perfect for when you have a large group staying in the room) and the bathroom also included a nice, large soaker tub as well as a glass-enclosed shower. The living room was located just off the entrance and was surprisingly roomy; it had a giant LCD TV on the wall built into the wood paneling and a fairly comfortable pull-out couch. A small half-bathroom with toilet/sink was located off the living room by the entrance to the suite.
reviews.title: Ritzy and Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: The Ritz here is fresh, modern, plus and well-appointed with great amenities including thoughtful little things like a toothbrush kit and a shave kit. Because it is a Marriott product, you now can collect Ritz Carlton points. That is a bonus over the Four Seasons, although the finish quality is slightly less plus than the 2.0 Four Seasons light-wood style.

reviews.text: The service is really great for a fresh hotel only four months old. You don't get a sense that it's not "broken in" - the staff is capable and attentive, and out-of-the-way until you need them, and they take care of things fast.

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on business. Rooms are large and tastefully decorated. Good size bathrooms with high quality fittings (I liked the TV embedded within the mirror). The hotel is very new and seems to lack much atmosphere - we had a drink at the sushi bar which had a "shopping mall" feel rather than a 5 Star hotel. Did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurants. Tried to order room service breakfast before I left for the airport was told it would be "at least half an hour" (for museli and coffee?!) so abandoned the idea and ate at the airport instead. I understand that there will be a Shangri-La opening in Toronto next year and so there will be more competition at this level for the RC. Price we paid via our corporate rate seemed high.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: From the moment you step foot in this hote, you know you are in for a treat. Best service ever from valet to concierge level. We had the concierge level room and Scott check us in not missing any single details. Room was great, clean, awesome tv on bathroom behind the mirrow. Great views of Toronto.
reviews.title: Best Hotel ever! Stay here no matter what you'll enjoy.
